issues.description: The problem statement refers to ingredient names in lowercase (e.g., 'bacon', 'beans'), while the template and solution repositories use title case (e.g., 'Bacon', 'Beans') for the same conceptual entities. This discrepancy in string casing for ingredient identifiers could lead to failures in case-sensitive string comparisons, causing confusion for students when mapping problem requirements to code implementations.
issues.suggested_fix: Standardize all ingredient names to lowercase across the problem statement, template repository, and solution repository to ensure consistent casing and prevent string comparison errors. For example, change all references from 'Bacon' to 'bacon' in the code files.
